alert.note: Alert for Mercer (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 14 at 5:54PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Mercer County through 615 PM EDT... At 554 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles south of Lawrenceburg, moving south at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Harrodsburg. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
